item.title: Trouble add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "All God does is watch us and kill us when we get boring. We must never, ever be boring." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Trouble add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Trouble add a quote by John Henry Newman
item.description:
"Cease, stranger, cease those witching notes, The art of syren choirs; Hush the seductive voice that floats Across the trembling wires.
Music's ethereal power was given Not to dissolve our clay, But draw Promethean beams from heaven To purge the dross away." -- John Henry Newman

item.title: Trouble add a quote by Martin Heidegger
item.description: "Making itself intelligible is suicide for philosophy." -- Martin Heidegger

item.title: Trouble add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Trouble add a quote by Niels Bohr
item.description: "An expert is a person who has made all the mistakes that can be made in a very narrow field." -- Niels Bohr

item.title: Trouble add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Trouble add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Trouble add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Trouble add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Trouble add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "A human being is a part of the whole called by us universe, a part limited in time and space. He experiences himself, his thoughts and feeling as something separated from the rest, a kind of optical delusion of his consciousness. This delusion is a kind of prison for us, restricting us to our personal desires and to affection for a few persons nearest to us. Our task must be to free ourselves from this prison by widening our circle of compassion to embrace all living creatures and the whole of nature in its beauty." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Trouble add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Trouble add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Be not afraid of greatness. Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Trouble add a quote by Arthur Schopenhauer
item.description: "Talent hits a target no one else can hit. Genius hits a target no one else can see." -- Arthur Schopenhauer

item.title: Trouble add a quote by May Sarton
item.description: "We have to dare to be ourselves, however frightening or strange that self may prove to be." -- May Sarton

item.title: Trouble add a quote by Gary Kasparov
item.description: "If you don't take risks, you don't drink champagne. " -- Gary Kasparov

item.title: Trouble add a quote by Michael J. Nelson
item.description: "As grand and glorious as love is, it is not without its perils. Anyone who has felt the cruel pangs of rejection knows that love is best approached cautiously, as one would approach an angry, cornered brush-tailed possum. Yes, before throwing yourself into a relationship, it's wise to buy a sturdy pair of leather gloves, and to be extra careful of love's front claws and rows of needle-sharp teeth." -- Michael J. Nelson

item.title: Trouble add a quote by Charles R. Swindoll
item.description: "Life is 10% what happens to you and 90% how you react to it." -- Charles R. Swindoll

item.title: Trouble add a quote by james frey
item.description: "The Babar the Elephant book is sitting in front of me. I pick it up and start reading it. I remember reading it as a small Boy and enjoying it and imagining that I was friends with Babar, his constant Companion during all of his adventures. He went to the moon, I went with him. He fought Tomb Raiders in Egypt, I fought alongside him. He rescued his elephant girlfriend from Ivory Hunters on the Savanna, I coordinated the getaway. I loved that goddamn Elephant and I loved being his friend. In a childhood full of unhappiness and rage, Babar is one of the few pleasant memories that I have. Me and Babar, kicking some motherfucking ass." -- james frey

item.title: Trouble add a quote by Orson Scott Card
item.description: "And enough for me that when my hand touched your shoulder, you leaned on me; and when you felt me slip away, you called my name." -- Orson Scott Card

item.title: Trouble add a quote by Robert Fulghum
item.description: "I believe that imagination is stronger than knowledge. That myth is more potent than history. That dreams are more powerful than facts. That hope always triumphs over experience. That laughter is the only cure for grief. And I believe that love is stronger than death." -- Robert Fulghum

item.title: Trouble add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Trouble add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Trouble add a quote by Nancy Thayer
item.description: "It's never too late - in fiction or in life - to revise." -- Nancy Thayer

item.title: Trouble add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me naïve or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Trouble add a quote by John Irving
item.description: "What is hardest to accept about the passage of time is that the people who once mattered the most to us wind up in parentheses." -- John Irving

item.title: Trouble add a quote by Jules Renard
item.description: "It`s not how old you are, it`s how you are old." -- Jules Renard

item.title: Trouble add a quote by E.J. Dionne Jr.
item.description: "...if Clinton's answers come off as well-intended lectures, Obama is offering soaring sermons and generational opportunity. In 1960, the articulate Adlai Stevenson compared his own oratory unfavorably with John F. Kennedy's. "Do you remember," Stevenson said, "that in classical times when Cicero had finished speaking, the people said, 'How well he spoke,' but when Demosthenes had finished speaking, the people said, 'Let us march.' " At this hour, Obama is the Democrats' Demosthenes." -- E.J. Dionne Jr.

item.title: Trouble add a quote by William Hazlitt
item.description: "Look up, laugh loud, talk big, keep the color in your cheek and the fire in your eye, adorn your person, maintain your health, your beauty, and your animal spirits." -- William Hazlitt

item.title: Trouble add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey
